attributes.action: Give college/sixth form students loans just like university students
attributes.background: Many people can not attend college sometimes due to not being able to afford things like the bus or metro, and not everybody is eligible for the bursary. However, the bursary is not enough for some people, for example £14 a week can not cover a £20 weekly bus pass.
attributes.additional_details: In addition, many students struggle to buy things such as notebooks and pens and textbooks needed to study. How is it fair that uni students can get loans yet we can't? We would pay it back once we completed studies and got jobs; it's very hard for a 16/17 year old to get a job these days especially without experience. It is very hard to get a job to support ourselves whilst studying a levels- it is simply too stressful which could effect our results and futures.

attributes.action: Get Saddleworth Back Into West riding of Yorkshire; Separate From Oldham!
attributes.background: In 1866 saddleworth became a civil parish in its own right and in 1889 became part of the administrative county of the West Riding of Yorkshire. In 1894 the parish's boundaries were altered with the parts in Quickmere Middle Division (Springhead), Mossley and Uppermill becoming Urban Districts.
attributes.additional_details: The residue became a single-parish rural district. Unfortunately in 1996 the boundaries were changed for the worst & Saddleworth became a part of Oldham, this needs to be reverted back! we should be our own district again belonging to west Yorkshire. please sign this petition to get our boundaries changed back!

attributes.action: Ask the Government to issue a medal to the wounded military serving personnel.
attributes.background: Unlike the United States who issue the Purple Heart Medal, the British Armed Services do not recognize the sacrifices made by those who serve and are wounded or killed during their service by way of a special medal. We believe it is shameful that such a medal does not exist and needs to be rectified
attributes.additional_details: We ask the British Government to create a special medal to be awarded to servicemen and servicewomen who, while serving under competent authority in any capacity with one of the UK Armed Forces has been wounded or killed. We also ask that the Government consider that this medal be posthumously awarded to qualifying servicemen and servicewomen who have been wounded or killed since the 28th July 1914.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: Have a referendum on health and social welfare funding for the next generation.
attributes.background: Health and social welfare funding is a subject very dear to voters but one whose effects run longer than the lives of any Parliament, or the careers of many Civil Servants or politicians.  Whether the UK has a US or Scandinavian model for health and social provision should be subject to plebiscite.
attributes.additional_details: I am a hospital consultant and fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, and feel that this is one of the bigger issues of relevance to people currently, and one which is not adequately exposed or debated within the short lives of Parliaments.

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: "Parliamentary privilege" must not be used to keep members above the law
attributes.background: Despite having been jailed for fiddling expenses in 2011, a new CPS case of false accounting against sitting Tory peer Lord Hannigfield recently collapsed when Justice McCreath ruled he couldn’t be prosecuted for falsely claiming attendance allowance – on the grounds of “parliamentary privilege”!
attributes.additional_details:
This taints the reputation of both Houses, makes a mockery of reforms following the "expenses" scandal and sets the dangerous precedent of placing parliamentarians' expenses beyond public scrutiny or prosecution.

Therefore, we call on both Houses to debate and reform the practical application of "parliamentary privilege" in cases of prosecutable false accounting or fraud. Also, along with this, members subsequently convicted in the courts should automatically be deprived of their seats/titles.

attributes.action: Require all dogs to be on leads in public places
attributes.background: In public places, such as fields used for football or other things, dogs cause havoc by roaming free and urinating wherever they please whilst their owners turn a blind eye or claim that the dog won't hurt anyone. Sufficient excercise can be gained by walking with them on a lead

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Introduce a compulsory quiet time every day to avoid noise pollution for all.
attributes.background: In other countries there are certain times of day when noise pollution is against the law. We would all benefit from knowing we can look forward to a certain time of day when we can be sure we won't be disturbed by other's noise.

attributes.action: Institute a Parliamentary medal  for an  historic contribution to  democracy
attributes.background:
This award will be specifically for contributions to parliamentary democracy as distinct from other types of contributions to public life or to the work of the government or the crown.

 The model should be the Congressional Gold Medal of the United States
attributes.additional_details: For example without the actions of a private citizen Gina Miller  Article 50 would not have been debated in parliament. Gina a private citizen lead a movement resulting in  a historic Supreme Court judgement which will resound down the ages and clarify  the balance of power between parliament and the government. Such a historic contribution to parliamentary democracy should be recognised by the Gold Medal.

attributes.action: Make it law all cars sold  that the driving licence Number of new keeper ON V5
attributes.background: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the communites of the UK
attributes.additional_details: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the community. Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my fiancé takes out our kids and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! He either has to use the floor or do it in the car which isnt ideal. There are so many more involved dads nowadays, we need to make things more accessible for them too!

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.

attributes.action: To have all school zones become 20mph for the safety of children.
attributes.background: We expect all of our children to go to school safely often schools are on busy main roads or down country lanes.  Visibility of the children can be poor and parents having to go on to work, parking can also cause a temporary hazard.  We fairly request roads have their speed limits lowered to 20mph.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Safety Analysis (RSA) body found that there were 85,814 road incidents within a 500 mtr radius of a school equating to more than a 1,000 per month.  In 2014 the Department of Transport confirmed road deaths or serious had risen in each quarter compared to 2013.  In this period the DfT confirmed incidents increased by 6%.

These are frightening figures and it wouldn't take much to put up a few signs telling motorists to reduce their speed to 20mph at national government cost.

attributes.action: Make Jaywalking (crossing the road in undesignated places) An Offence
attributes.background: Jaywalking has become a serious problem in the UK, pedestrians have a total disregard for traffic. It is dangerous and results in many fatal accidents. The UK has plenty of Zebra crossings and pedestrian traffic  lights. It's a matter of life & death and it's time to make it an offence.
attributes.additional_details:
Jaywalking occurs when a pedestrian crosses a road where it's not safe to do so. Examples include crossing in middle of the road, between junctions, when a traffic light is green for traffic, or not by a zebra crossing. 
In Many countries, including the Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Israel, Poland, USA and many other Countries, Jaywalking is an Offence

attributes.action: Allow a recall of mps petition without suspension or criminal charge
attributes.background: Currently the recall of mps bill only allows for a recall petition to be triggered if there is a criminal charge against your MP or if they have been suspended from the House. I believe that it should be possible to start a petition to recall your MP if you believe they aren't representing you.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act to present wrong information to influence a public vote.
attributes.background: With the recent public vote in the UK it is clear that the argument was heavily influenced by individuals knowingly communicating wrong information.  The act of knowingly presenting unverified facts for influence should be  punished.  The message is that our democracy will not accept such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: There has in the past year been an upsurge in politicians and individuals presenting fake facts to influence votes of national importance.  These "fake facts" and "fake news" have been seen as an acceptable tactic by the perpetrators. Our country needs to get this under control and send a signal because its continuation will undermine the democratic process.  Without sanctions these types of lies will undermine our society. The action needs to cover both traditional and social media.

attributes.action: Make dog theft a criminal offence with custodial sentence and hefty fines.
attributes.background: All too often, we read in local papers and facebook groups that dogs are being stolen, whether it be for fights or breeding. These animals are not just pets from some people but dearly loved members of the family. When thieves take an animal they leave a huge whole in the hearts of those left behind
attributes.additional_details: Every day we read about another dog stolen, the heartbreak that families & individuals are going through. The hours spent distrubuting leafts, posters for just some hint of where their pet maybe.  In one area alone, I have hears of 3 cockers missing within a matter of days of each other. Coincidence? At a dog walking area: reports of people walking with a lead and no dog,  on one occasion, a young lad  confronted the "walker" because it was his dog that had was now on the empty lead.

attributes.action: Make it law for all animal care workers to be animal first aid trained.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, it is not a legal requirement for animal care workers e.g. groomers, pet sitters, dog walkers, animal trainers and animal boarding, to have any animal first aid training. Through this petition we want pets to have the best care possible and ensure their welfare is paramount.
attributes.additional_details:
With this petition, we ask that it become law that ALL animal care workers have pet first aid training. As with all work places that legally must have human first aid qualified staff, we recommend that all animal-based businesses also have the same controls and measures in place that ensure staff are animal first aid trained.
Further, that animal care workers commit to undertake and continue with CPD, throughout their careers, to ensure that they have up-to-date animal first aid qualifications.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the relationship between the UK and the EU after the exit.
attributes.background: Give the citizens of the United Kingdom the opportunity to decide if they want to maintain the access to the European Single Market without being a member of the European Union, either through a membership of the European Economic Area or through bilateral treaties (Swiss paradigm).

attributes.action: Put the Investigatory Powers Bill to a referendum.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill is a piece of legislation that seriously infringes our right to a private life. The bill has been scarcely covered in the media and I believe that the British people should be given the opportunity to decide for themselves whether we are willing to give up our freedoms.
attributes.additional_details:
I urge everyone who reads this to do some extra research on the Investigatory Powers Bill, and other similar mass surveillance programs around the world, such as the NSA's Prism program. Please look up interviews from Edward Snowden and decide for yourself whether he is a traitor or a hero.

If the people decide that these programs and losing our rights are a worthy sacrifice for protection from terrorism then so be it, however, as it stands we have not been given a choice.

attributes.action: Make Religious Education optional
attributes.background: I am in Year 10 and we have to do RE. It is long and boring so I think that it should be optional. I am not religious yet I still have to learn about Christianity and Hinduism.
attributes.additional_details: It shouldn't affect the current Year 10 and 11s but should affect the upcoming Year 10s

attributes.action: Legalisation of Medical and Medicinal cannabis, in the United Kindom.
attributes.background: Report by Adam Smith Institute says UK’s drug strategy ‘has failed in its core aims’ and urges government to legalise cannabis
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis should be legalised in the UK, according to a report that has the backing of several cross-party MPs including the former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg.

Current cannabis policy in Britain is a “messy patchwork” of legislation intermittently enforced by regional police and an embarrassment, says the report by the free-market thinktank the Adam Smith Institute.

attributes.action: Raise paternity pay to a minimum of 75% of your weekly income
attributes.background: Currently paternity leave is around £140 or 90% of your weekly income whichever is lower. Due to this fathers cant afford to take time off to be with a newborn or have to take annual leave. I myself just had a child and cant take paternity leave as I would be over £200 out of pocket each week.
attributes.additional_details: Lets get this to parliament and give fathers the chance to be with their kids from the start. There are all these fathers who don't want to spend time with their kids and the ones who do can't. Lets change this for fathers and kids in the UK lets allow fathers to bond with their newborns. Please sign this petition. THANKS

attributes.action: Ban all landlords from stopping tenants having pets.
attributes.background: Currently in the uk millions of people are either private or housing association tenants, that rises each year. At present a landlord can tell a tenant if they can or can't have a pet. Approximately 7 million+ animals enter shelters each year. No landlord should have the right to disallow pets.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and “speaking patterns”
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: Bring back 30mph NATIONAL SPEED LIMIT (20mph is not practical on main roads)
attributes.background: Since setting of speed limits was relaxed, local councils have set inappropriate limits on main roads (sometimes across entire boroughs) without proper consultation (typically 20% or less of residents) and not used "LOCAL KNOWLEDGE" as suggested in Gov guidance. 20 is NOT PLENTY (in most cases)
attributes.additional_details:
With a 30 mph national limit, motorists knew where they stood legally

Southwark council consulted less than 400 people in their scheme to make the entire borough a 20mph zone (over 200,000 voters live in Southwark.

Islington cannot provide data to show the 20 mph borough has improved safety or reduced accidents

Most councils will use these artificially low limits as a revenue raiser, Traffic speed is slow enough in London without a 24hour 20mph limit being imposed unnecessarily.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all major UK roads and round-a-bouts to have CCTV
attributes.background: I am A university student at MMU. After experiencing a car crash on the underpass of Mancunion way on a major round-a-bout with both my flatmate and her friend. The police as helpful as they were, had no CCTV to catch the culprit.
attributes.additional_details:
The police, although busy, were wonderful in regards to the situation. After a Nissan Juke hitting a little car into a lamppost, the car was a write off. The man drove off, before we were even out of the car and the police, afterwards, informed us that there were no CCTV on the round-a-bout or on any of the roads in the direction he went.

I'm aware of multiple others having similar experiences, and feel that it would be both beneficial to the victims and the police to have CCTV on major roads.

attributes.action: Return to the previous method of calculating Child Maintenance Payments.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service takes an estranged parents income direct from HMRC records.  This means that this now includes "income" listed on the HMRC listing that may be for benefit in kind taxation purposes and not be cash in a parents bank which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Rt Hon Damien Green needs to order a review of the changes to return to the old method of calculating CSA payments from net income which is the only disposable income an estranged parent has control over.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to Vehicle Excise Duty Tax
attributes.background: On the 1st April 2017, new Tax Laws are to be introduced that will introduce a flat rate for all non-Zero Emission to £140 per year and an additional £310 'premium' for all vehicles with a new price of £40,000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Though it may reduce the rate on high emission vehicles, there is no benefit to the taxpayer unless the vehicle produces more than 266g/km due to the hefty first year rate.

For example a Lexus IS 300h Hybrid at the current rate costs £40 over 3 years. Under the new scheme £560 would be the tax over 3 years.

Also this affects many Zero-Emission Cars such as the Tesla Model S. Currently they would pay £0 but as the value is over £40,000 when new, owners would have to pay £310 per year for an EV.

attributes.action: Make the speed limits for larger vans the same as cars.
attributes.background: Transit sized vans are restricted to 50mph on single carriageways which anyone that drives one knows is not always a good thing. More time in your van means less work can be done.  Also it seems no one wants to be stuck behind a van at 50mph.  Reckless overtaking of vans is a common occurrence.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing the speed limit in line with cars would be a good thing and could possibly cause less accidents.  Vans are as safe as a lot of cars nowadays.

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Make Mr Jeremy Hunt work in a busy hospital for a week so he can see for himself
attributes.background: It seems Mr Jeremy Hunt has an inaccurate view of the NHS and the pressure on it. Before he runs into the ground one of the greatest achievements in world history that is a big part of being British, he should work 12 hour shifts for a week to see how the system needs help.

attributes.action: Lobby the IOC in order for Darts to become an Olympic Sport.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport should create a task force in order to lobby the IOC for Darts to be recognised as a sport. They should then have direct involvement in the process of applying to become an Olympic Sport at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.additional_details:
Darts meets almost all requirements stipulated by the Olympic charter.

Sports with similar characteristics are currently already included in the Olympic programme such as Archery and Shooting. Darts is a true test of precision, accuracy, strategy, hand-eye coordination and pressure.

We, the undersigned urge the Government to step in, in order for Darts to have the best chance at becoming an Olympic Sport, and to gain the recognition the sport and it's competitors deserve.

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Funding for Birmingham homeless shelters and free education/job seekers help
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We're asking for the government to invest in the UK's second largest city & provide support who most need it. We want free education and job seeker support to help get people off the streets. We also need equipment and resources.

attributes.action: Ensure every local government has homeless shelters and support workers for free
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are trying to help homeless people by making it legal for all councils to have homeless shelters that are available 24/7. We also want to see an increase in funding for support workers who offer valuable advice.

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Ban cyclist strobe lights and flashing lights.
attributes.background: We all know the lights, the ones that blind you and flash at you and distract you whilst driving. A dimmer, non-flashing light would be much safer, the amount of people I have seen driving get distracted by those lights are ridiculous!

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!
